Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for <FI>this<Fi> I make haste.<RF>I make…: Heb. my haste is in me<Rf>
I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.
Knowest thou <FI>not<Fi> this of old, since man was placed upon earth,
That the triumphing of the wicked <FI>is<Fi> short, and the joy of the hypocrite <FI>but<Fi> for a moment?<RF>short: Heb. from near<Rf>
Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds;<RF>clouds: Heb. cloud<Rf>
<FI>Yet<Fi> he shall perish for ever like his own dung: they which have seen him shall say, Where <FI>is<Fi> he?
He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.
The eye also <FI>which<Fi> saw him shall <FI>see him<Fi> no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.<CM>
His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.<RF>His children…: or, The poor shall oppress his children<Rf>
His bones are full <FI>of the sin<Fi> of his youth, which shall lie down with him in the dust.
Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, <FI>though<Fi> he hide it under his tongue;
<FI>Though<Fi> he spare it, and forsake it not; but keep it still within his mouth:<RF>within…: Heb. in the midst of his palate<Rf>
<FI>Yet<Fi> his meat in his bowels is turned, <FI>it is<Fi> the gall of asps within him.
He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.
He shall suck the poison of asps: the viper's tongue shall slay him.
He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.<RF>the floods…: or, streaming brooks<Rf>

That which he laboured for shall he restore, and shall not swallow <FI>it<Fi> down: according to <FI>his<Fi> substance <FI>shall<Fi> the restitution <FI>be<Fi>, and he shall not rejoice <FI>therein<Fi>.<RF>his…: Heb. the substance of his exchange<Rf>
Because he hath oppressed <FI>and<Fi> hath forsaken the poor; <FI>because<Fi> he hath violently taken away an house which he builded not;<RF>oppressed: Heb. crushed<Rf>
Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly, he shall not save of that which he desired.<RF>feel: Heb. know<Rf>
There shall none of his meat be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.<RF>none…: or, be none left for his meat<Rf>
In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.<RF>wicked: or, troublesome<Rf><CM>
<FI>When<Fi> he is about to fill his belly, <FI>God<Fi> shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him, and shall rain <FI>it<Fi> upon him while he is eating.
He shall flee from the iron weapon, <FI>and<Fi> the bow of steel shall strike him through.
It is drawn, and cometh out of the body; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall: terrors <FI>are<Fi> upon him.
All darkness <FI>shall be<Fi> hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.
The heaven shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall rise up against him.
The increase of his house shall depart, <FI>and his goods<Fi> shall flow away in the day of his wrath.
This <FI>is<Fi> the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed unto him by God.<RF>appointed…: Heb. of his decree from God<Rf><CM>
